item.title: Why Emacs is my default programming editor... again
item.description: If you’re a developer or simply an open-source adopter you have probably come across Emacs. For the eyes of the inexperienced an incomprehensible bunch of letters in an ugly layout, for the experienced an awesome productivity tool.

item.title: Why 1:1 meetings must be taken seriously
item.description: I’ve been reading The Manager’s Path from Camille Fournier. This is a classic resource for those looking for some advices about management, specially in the software development sector. I’m not going to comment the book, you can already find good reviews all around there.

item.title: OpenSouthCode 2023
item.description: I had the honour of attending the OpenSouthCode 2023 held at the beatiful Málaga between June 9th and 10th. This is my brief summary of the event, and an invitation for everybody to attend this community-driven event.

item.title: Questions you should ask before starting a PhD
item.description: This post is dedicated to all of you who are thinking about pursuing a PhD. If you have ever applied for a job, you would probably know that you are expected to do your homework to maximize your opportunities and be sure that you are applying for the correct position.

item.title: Thoughts after one year using Amazon's KDP
item.description: Time flies by. That’s a known fact. It’s been more than a year since I published [Build Systems with Go]({% link _pages/2021-04-05-build-systems-with-go.md %}). I have already talked about [how does it feel to write a programming book]({% post_url 2021-04-05-writing-a-programming-book-in-2021 %}).

item.title: Migration from Wordpress to Jekyll
item.description: This blog was born almost two years ago during the Covid-19 lockdown. At that time I decided to use a hosted WordPress solution. I have to say that I did not spend too much time checking alternatives.

item.title: Writing a Programming Book in 2021 (part II)
item.description: This post is a continuation of a previous one where I explained some aspects of my experience writing and self-publishing a programming book. Well, yesterday the blog multiplied its traffic by 100,000.

item.title: We Have to Define What is Edge Computing
item.description: The first time I heard about edge computing was back in 2015. Since then, I have been working for startups to enable distributed data-driven solutions for the edge. It looks like everybody (or almost everybody) is aware of what edge computing is.

item.title: Graph processing: a problem with no clear victor
item.description: We all depend on the Internet to search for potential solutions to technical problems. For example, for big data problems after five minutes in Google you will find out that Spark may help you.
